page.title: 07HARTPURY PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: Seven people form Hartpury Parish Council. They are elected by the parishioners (aged 18 years and above) to be responsible for the affairs of the community. They serve as the interface between the District Council and the people, representing their views to the Authority. The Parish Council has the declared objective of retaining a rural environment and supports the Gloucestershire Structure Plan which limits construction in the village to 25 dwellings in the next 15 years and envisages the 'detrunking' of the A417. The Parish Council is the driving force behind Hartpury's success in the Bledisloe Cup for the best kept village and also for the publication of a footpath booklet detailing local walks.
